title: Body found on M5 carriageway with police warning of significant delays
text:
Gloucestershire Police were called to the scene early this morning (Picture: Adamleeke)

A person has been found dead on the M5 motorway, Gloucestershire Police have said.

Officers have now closed the carriageway on both sides between junction 11A at Brockworth and junction 12 for Quedgeley, a spokesperson confirmed this morning.

The incident was reportedly shortly before 4.10am.

A serious incident investigation is now taking place and emergency service teams are working to remove the body from the road.

Diversions have been put in place, but officers said a ‘significant disruption’ to traffic can be expected to last for a ‘number of hours’.

Police are still establishing the circumstances of the death.

Anyone with more information is asked to call the police on 101, while quoting incident 34 of 30 October.

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
description: A body has been found on the M5 motorway between junction 11A at Brockworth and junction 12 for Quedgeley, Gloucestershire Police said.
